page.title: 08Kington :Anglican Religion
page.content: Kington has got a very nice church called St. Mary's. It stands on one of the highest points in the town. It has undergone a lot of restoration but much of it is still the same as when it was built. It is thought that a {Saxon}church stood on the site and that a{Norman}church replaced it. St. Mary's is now part of a team ministry with 13 other churches. There are 4 priests for them all but from September 1985 there will only be 3. There is a choir of men, women and children. Sometimes there is an Activity Day for children to do drama, crafts, etc. A service is held for Brownies and Guides on Thinking Day. There is a Sunday School. St. Mary's is used by Lady Hawkins' School especially for the Foundress Day Service held every year on the 29th of September.
